meanings.definition: To make a shrill, high-pitched sound
meanings.sent1: The teapot was fritting loudly on the stove.
meanings.sent2: The birds outside were fritting in the trees.
meanings.sent3: The squeaky door was fritting like a tiny trumpet player.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter fritted through the room like a sudden whistle.
meanings.sent5: The alarm clock fritted in the morning air, waking everyone up.

meanings.definition: To waste time or energy in a nervous or aimless way
meanings.sent1: He was fritting away his afternoon playing video games.
meanings.sent2: Stop fritting and focus on your homework.
meanings.sent3: She kept fritting around the house instead of doing her chores.
meanings.sent4: Time fritted away like sand slipping through his fingers.
meanings.sent5: The cat fritted around the room, chasing its tail in circles.

meanings.definition: A state of nervousness or agitation
meanings.sent1: Her fritting was evident as she tapped her foot anxiously.
meanings.sent2: The constant fritting in the waiting room made everyone uneasy.
meanings.sent3: His fritting was like a squirrel running back and forth in his mind.
meanings.sent4: The fritting in the air was palpable before the big announcement.
meanings.sent5: The fritting in her stomach felt like a swarm of butterflies fluttering.
